message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public class PersonIterator implements Iterator<Person> {
    private List<List<Person>> list;
    private int outerIndex = 0;
    private int innerIndex = 0;

    public PersonIterator(List<List<Person>> list) {
        this.list = list;
    }

    @Override
    public boolean hasNext() {
        while (outerIndex < list.size() && innerIndex == list.get(outerIndex).size()) {
            outerIndex++;
            innerIndex = 0;
        }
        return outerIndex < list.size();
    }

    @Override
    public Person next() {
        if (!hasNext()) {
            throw new NoSuchElementException();
        }
        return list.get(outerIndex).get(innerIndex++);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: This iterator works by maintaining two indices: one for the outer list and one for the inner lists. The hasNext method checks if there are any more elements in the current inner list, and if not, it moves to the next outer list and resets the inner index. The next method returns the next element in the current inner list and increments the inner index.
